layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: Actions have consequences; you reap what you sow.

questions.text: My current life situation is largely the result of my accumulated choices ...

answers.4: mostly — my choices have shaped most of where I am
answers.5: largely — I am the accumulated result of my decisions
answers.2: possibly — but luck and timing matter more
answers.3: partially — some of it is my choices, some is fate
answers.1: not really — I'm mostly shaped by circumstances beyond my control

questions.text: I can trace most of my successes and failures back to specific decisions ...

answers.4: usually — I can identify the decision chain for most results
answers.5: clearly — successes and failures have identifiable origins
answers.3: sometimes — some outcomes trace back, others seem random

questions.text: Procrastination, avoidance, and inaction are choices with predictable consequences ...

answers.4: usually — not deciding is deciding, with predictable results
answers.5: always — inaction compounds just like action does
answers.3: sometimes — some inaction costs me, some doesn't
answers.1: not really — sometimes delay works out fine

questions.text: When I think 'it just happened,' there are actually causes I could identify ...

answers.4: usually — if I look, I can find the causal chain
answers.5: almost always — 'it just happened' is almost never true
answers.2: possibly — but it's hard to trace back
answers.3: sometimes — some things have causes, some don't
answers.1: not always — some things really are random

questions.text: Small daily choices compound into life trajectories over time ...
questions.principle: Daily choices compound into life direction

answers.4: mostly — daily patterns shape long-term outcomes
answers.5: absolutely — compound effect applies to everything
answers.2: possibly — but daily choices feel insignificant
answers.3: somewhat — some small choices matter, others don't
answers.1: not really — big decisions are what matter

remediation.advice: Write down where you are in three key life areas. Then trace backward: what decisions led here? Be brutally honest. The goal isn't guilt — it's understanding that if choices got you here, different choices can get you somewhere else.

scripture.text: Do not be deceived: God cannot be mocked. A man reaps what he sows.
